timeline.bodyText:
I don't think it's related to your change, but I've noticed that on Android, when using on, the notification is fired at the same second it was scheduled, while on iOS it's fired on second 0.
Example, I want to fire a notification at 19:10
On iOS it fires at 19:10:00
On Android it fires at 19:10:XY, where XY can be any second based on the second it was scheduled, so can be any value from 00 to 59, there could be almost 1 minute of difference.
I think it makes more sense iOS behavior, if you set it to "minute 10" it should fire at exact 10 minute and 0 seconds, not to an unpredictable second.
I've accomplished that by adding this line

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                
          
          
            
                next.set(Calendar.SECOND, 0);
          
      
    
    
  

If you think it makes sense, accept the suggestion by using the "commit suggestion" button.
